title: Gravitational force - asteroid mass and distance

content.question: Two asteroids of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> are in deep space far away from any other objects. The centers of the asteroids are a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> apart where <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> is much larger than the size of the asteroids, and each asteroid exerts a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> on the other. At a later time, the mass of each asteroid has increased to <math alttext="2 M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></math> and they are a distance <math alttext="the fraction d over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> apart. What is the magnitude of the force that each asteroid exerts on the other at this later time?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
